column7:

VARAMAR open with below special position today:
m/v “BEAUTROPHY” - open BLACK SEA - 25-28 APRIL
Seeking PART CARGO ON / UNDER DECK direction PG/ INDIA / FAR EAST

MV  Ceylon Breeze    - OPEN  Puttalam  16/19 Apr
===
Built Jan 2016
Type Bulk Carrier
IMO No. 9734563
Flag Sri Lanka
Class DNV-GL
Dimensions 
LOA: 199.813 M
Beam: 32.251 M (mld)
Depth: 18.494 M (mld)
Summer : 13.299 m
Winter : 13.022 m
Tropical : 13.576 m
Fresh Water : 13.601 m
Tropical FW : 13.576
Tonnage/Mt
Deadweight (Summer) : 63,323.9 T
Displacement at Scantling draft: 75,190.3 T
GT 36,432
NT 21,628
Capacity:
Hold 1: 19.68 m x 18.26 m /13,957.79 Cm
Hold 2: 22.96 m x 18.26 m /13,658.30 Cm
Hold 3: 22.96 m x 18.26 m /15,352.99 Cm
Hold 4: 22.96 m x 18.26 m /15,839.60 Cm
Hold 5: 22.96 m x 18.26 m /15,942.06 Cm
Total: 74,750.74 cbm
Cargo gear
Make and Type : MACGREGER
Number and capacity of cranes/ derricks : Four cranes, 30 MT SWL Electro Hydraulic Cranes
with Grab capacity of 12 CBM
Outreach : 4.0M/30 M
Load distribution Tank top strength
Hold 1: 20 Mt/ SQM
Hold 2: 20 Mt/ SQM
Hold 3: 20 Mt/ SQM
Hold 4: 20 Mt/ SQM
Hold 5: 20 Mt/ SQM
Strengthened for heavy cargoes : Alternative loading, hold 2 and 4 empty.
No deck cargo allowed.
Bunker Specification
IFO 380cst RMG 380, ISO 8217 / 2010& MDO Class DMB ISO 8217/ 2010 or
DMB/DMZ/DMA as per ISO 8217/2010
No mixing allowed
No bunkering of Ultra LSFO allowed
 
Speed & Consumption at sea
Service speeds and Fuel consumptions are in Good weather conditions ( up to Beaufort Wind Scale 4 or up to Douglas sea state 3 with significant wave height max 1.25 m), in deep water and no adverse current conditions.
Consumption for M/E + A/E - IFO 380cst RMG 380, ISO 8217:2010.
 
Laden condition:
abt. 11.00 Kts = abt 26.5 Mts/day
abt. 12.00 Kts = abt 29.4 Mts/day
Ballast condition
abt 11.00 Kts = abt 22.5 Mts/day
abt 12.00 Kts = abt 23.5 Mts/day
abt 13.00 Kts = abt 25.0 Mts/day
 
The above consumptions are based on the Engine Load (up to maximum 85%)
 
Vessel may consume MDO in Main Engine/generators for warming up of the system & Start/Stop. Vessel runs two generators for Steaming in/out of Port, shifting berth/anchorage, navigating in congested waters/inland waters/channels, during poor visibility; during load/discharging at anchorage on Barges/lighters with bad weather and /or strong currents, ballast exchanges, holds washing, and in-port running of boiler. Vessel will also consume additional 1.5mt IFO per day when using boilers in port.
 
For the purpose of this clause, the average speed and average bunker consumption shall be calculated by reference to the observed distance from pilot station to pilot station on the high seas and by reference to periods of 24 hours, from engine full away on departure to engine slow down on arrival. 
 
The average Speed and Consumption is to be assessed in good weather conditions only, which is defined as under Beaufort scale four, under Douglas sea state three, and always excluding any time during which (i) reduction of speed is necessary for safety due to navigation in congested waters or during poor visibility; (ii) any periods when vessel is ballasting/deballasting or during cleaning of cargo holds ; (iii) under influence of swell and or tidal streams and/or currents; (iv) when vessel is manoeuvring within harbour, inland waters, channels, where slow speed is required due to national/international and local regulations and all times when pilot is on board; (vi) when vessel is following/proceeding in convoy, using escorts, or following instructions of underwriters, government of Nation under whose flag the vessel sails, security council of the United Nations or other supranational body when navigating in Pirate infested areas. 
 
Fuel Consumptions at Port
One Aux. Engine without cargo operation - about 2.5 Mts IFO/day 
Two Aux. Engines (cargo operation using two Crans) - about 3.7 Mts IFO/day 
Two Aux. Engines (cargo operation using more than two Crans) - about 4.6 Mts/day
Boiler min. 1.5 Mt/day in tropical area (depend on load/demand)
Boiler min 3.0 Mt/day in the winter season (depend on load/demand)
-ADA-


+

Hold 2: 22.96 m x 18.26 m /13,658.30 Cm

Total: 74,750.74 cbm
Cargo gear
Make and Type : MACGREGER
Number and capacity of cranes/ derricks : Four cranes, 30 MT SWL Electro Hydraulic Cranes
with Grab capacity of 12 CBM

Load distribution Tank top strength
Hold 1: 20 Mt/ SQM
Hold 2: 20 Mt/ SQM
Hold 3: 20 Mt/ SQM
Hold 4: 20 Mt/ SQM
Hold 5: 20 Mt/ SQM
Strengthened for heavy cargoes : Alternative loading, hold 2 and 4 empty.

Bunker Specification
IFO 380cst RMG 380, ISO 8217 / 2010& MDO Class DMB ISO 8217/ 2010 or
DMB/DMZ/DMA as per ISO 8217/2010
No mixing allowed
No bunkering of Ultra LSFO allowed

Speed & Consumption at sea
Service speeds and Fuel consumptions are in Good weather conditions ( up to Beaufort Wind Scale 4 or up to Douglas sea state 3 with significant wave height max 1.25 m), in deep water and no adverse current conditions.
Consumption for M/E + A/E - IFO 380cst RMG 380, ISO 8217:2010.

Laden condition:
abt. 11.00 Kts = abt 26.5 Mts/day
abt. 12.00 Kts = abt 29.4 Mts/day
Ballast condition
abt 11.00 Kts = abt 22.5 Mts/day
abt 12.00 Kts = abt 23.5 Mts/day
abt 13.00 Kts = abt 25.0 Mts/day

The above consumptions are based on the Engine Load (up to maximum 85%)

Vessel may consume MDO in Main Engine/generators for warming up of the system & Start/Stop. Vessel runs two generators for Steaming in/out of Port, shifting berth/anchorage, navigating in congested waters/inland waters/channels, during poor visibility; during load/discharging at anchorage on Barges/lighters with bad weather and /or strong currents, ballast exchanges, holds washing, and in-port running of boiler. Vessel will also consume additional 1.5mt IFO per day when using boilers in port.

For the purpose of this clause, the average speed and average bunker consumption shall be calculated by reference to the observed distance from pilot station to pilot station on the high seas and by reference to periods of 24 hours, from engine full away on departure to engine slow down on arrival.

The average Speed and Consumption is to be assessed in good weather conditions only, which is defined as under Beaufort scale four, under Douglas sea state three, and always excluding any time during which (i) reduction of speed is necessary for safety due to navigation in congested waters or during poor visibility; (ii) any periods when vessel is ballasting/deballasting or during cleaning of cargo holds ; (iii) under influence of swell and or tidal streams and/or currents; (iv) when vessel is manoeuvring within harbour, inland waters, channels, where slow speed is required due to national/international and local regulations and all times when pilot is on board; (vi) when vessel is following/proceeding in convoy, using escorts, or following instructions of underwriters, government of Nation under whose flag the vessel sails, security council of the United Nations or other supranational body when navigating in Pirate infested areas.

Fuel Consumptions at Port
One Aux. Engine without cargo operation - about 2.5 Mts IFO/day
Two Aux. Engines (cargo operation using two Crans) - about 3.7 Mts IFO/day
Two Aux. Engines (cargo operation using more than two Crans) - about 4.6 Mts/day
Boiler min. 1.5 Mt/day in tropical area (depend on load/demand)
Boiler min 3.0 Mt/day in the winter season (depend on load/demand)
-ADA-

+
END

column3: [SHIP-BROKER] MV MANDARIN SKY OPEN KSC 3-6 APR - PREFER TCT
column7:
FROM: TOSCO 

(PLS REPLY TO TOSCOSHIPPINGATGMAIL.COM <mailto:TOSCOSHIPPING@GMAIL.COM>  (PREFER) OR OPTATSHIPPING.NET.VN <mailto:OPT@SHIPPING.NET.VN> ) 

 

DEAR FRIENDS 

GOOD DAY 

 

PLS PROPOSE FIRM CARGO FOR OUR DIRECT TONNAGES ASF:

***************************** 

pls pps suitable cargo fr our flw vsl:

 

 

MV MANDARIN SKY OPEN KSC 3RD-6TH APR

CHINA DIRECTION ONLY.

N.ORE FRIDENDLY.

 

MV "MANDARIN SKY"

FLAG SINGAPORE BLT 2009

56,929MT SDWT ON 12.80M SSW MOULDED

GRT 32957 / NRT 19231

LOA 189.99M / BEAM 32.26M

5HO/5HA

CRANES: 4X36MT

GRABS: 4X12CBM

71,634M3 GRAIN

 

AT SEA: ABOUT 14.0 KNOTS (BALLAST) ON ABOUT 30.8 MT/DAY HFO (RMG380);

        ABOUT 13.5 KNOTS (LADEN) ON ABOUT 30.8 MT/DAY HFO (RMG380).

IN PORT (WORKING): ABOUT 6.4 MT/DAY HFO (RMG380) + ABOUT 0.2MT/DAY LSMGO

(DMA/SULPHUR CONTENT BELOW 0.1%); IN PORT (IDLE): ABOUT

3.4 MT/DAY HFO (RMG380) + ABOUT 0.2MT/DAY LSMGO (DMA/SULPHUR CONTENT BELOW

0.1%).

 

CHARTERERS ARE ALLOWED TO PERFORM THE VOYAGE(S) AT THE FOLLOWING MENTIONED

REDUCED SPEED/CONSUMPTION AT SEA.

 

LADEN         BALLAST       CONSUMPTION

KNOT (ABOUT)  KNOT (ABOUT)  MT (ABOUT)

13.0          13.5          28.8 (RMG380)

12.5          13.0          26.5 (RMG380)

12            12.5          24.5 (RMG380)

 

ALL DETAILS ABOUT

 

"ABOUT" MEANS HAVING AN ALLOWANCE OF 0.5KNOT ON SPEED AND 5% ON BUNKERS

OVER-CONSUMPTION, BOTH IN OWNERS FAVOR.

 

SPEEDS AND CONSUMPTIONS AS STATED ABOVE UNDER GOOD WEATHER CONDITION, SMOOTH

SEA, WITHOUT EXCEEDING BEAUFORT SCALE WIND FORCE 4

AND/OR DOUGLAS SEA STATE 3, WITHOUT ADVERSE CURRENT.

 

- THE VESSEL HAS THE LIBERTY OF USE MARINE GAS OIL FOR STARTING/ STOPPING OF

MAIN ENGINE, WHILE MANEUVERING IN SHALLOW/NARROW

WATERS, CANALS, RIVERS, IN/OUT OF PORTS AND DURING POOR VISIBILITY ALSO UNDER

MAINTENANCE WORKS.

 

***************************** 

 Thanks & Best Regards
Capt. Tosco (Mr. Son)

column3: [SHIP-BROKER] 57K VSL OPEN KOHSICHANG 31ST MAR
column7:
FROM: TOSCO 

(PLS REPLY TO TOSCOSHIPPINGATGMAIL.COM <mailto:TOSCOSHIPPING@GMAIL.COM>  (PREFER) OR OPTATSHIPPING.NET.VN <mailto:OPT@SHIPPING.NET.VN> ) 

 

DEAR FRIENDS 

GOOD DAY 

 

PLS PROPOSE FIRM CARGO FOR OUR DIRECT TONNAGES ASF:

***************************** 

MV KRANIA  OPEN KOHSICHANG 31ST MAR

 

MV KRANIA

57,400MT ON 13.00M SUMMER DRAFT (MLD)

BUILT STX DALIAN, DEL MARCH 2010

MARSHALL ISLANDS FLAG / CLASS LR

SINGLE DECK SELF-TRIMMING GEARED/GRABBED SUPRAMAX

CO2 FITTED

A60 BULKHEAD IWO ENGINE ROOM

ENERGY SAVING DEVICE: PROPELLOR BOSS CAP FIN (PBCF)

 

LOA: 190M / BEAM 32.26M

5 HO/5 HA

GRAIN: 71,967 M3

TPC: 57.3 MT/CM @ SCANTLING DRAFT

GT/NT: ABT 33,302 / ABT 19,342

4 X 30 MT SWL X 26M (MAX R) / (4 X 24 MT SWL IN GRAB MODE)

GRABS: 4 X MIN 6 CBM / MAX 12.5 CBM

 

SPEED/CONSUMPTION:

 

LADEN:

ABT 11.5 KN ON ABT 19.5MT/DAY HFO380

OR ABT 12.0 KN ON ABT 22MT/DAY HFO380

OR ABT 13.0 KN ON ABT 28MT/DAY HFO380

OR ABT 14.0 KN ON ABT 35.5MT/DAY HFO380

 

BALLAST:

ABT 11.5 KN ON ABT 19MT/DAY HFO380

OR ABT 12.0 KN ON ABT 20.5MT/DAY HFO380

OR ABT 13.0 KN ON ABT 26MT/DAY HFO380

OR ABT 14.0 KN ON ABT 32.5MT/DAY HFO380

 

SPEED CONSUMPTIONS BASIS ISO CONDITIONS AND FUEL LCV OF 10,200KCAL/KG, BASIS MAX BEAUFORT F4 AND/OR DOUGLAS SEA STATE 3 (DEFINED AT 1.25M EITHER TOTAL SEA HEIGHT OR SWELL), IN DEEP WATER, DURING PERIODS OF NO ADVERSE CURRENTS AND WITH CLEAN HULL/PROPELLER. PERFORMANCE TO BE CALCULATED ON THE AVERAGE OF BOTH LADEN AND BALLAST LEGS. VESSEL HAS THE LIBERTY OF USE DIESEL OIL FOR STARTING / STOPPING OF MAIN ENGINE AND GENERATORS, WHILE MANOEUVRING IN SHALLOW/NARROW WATERS, CANALS, RIVERS, IN/OUT OF PORTS.

DURING BALLAST EXCHANGE, CARGO HOLD WASHING, BAD WEATHER (INCL POOR VISIBILITY), RESTRICTED WATER NAVIGATION, PILOTAGE, LIGHTERING/BUNKERING OPERATIONS OR MAINTENANCE WORKS OR IN VERY COLD/WARM WEATHER THEN ADD 1.5 MT/DAY HFO.

 

IN PORT CONSUMPTION 3.5MT/DAY IDLE / 6MT/DAY WORKING WITH CRANES HFO380 CST PER 24 HRS (OR LSMGO AS PER APPLICABLE REGULATIONS).

 

ADA WOG

 

*****************************  

Thanks & Best Regards
Capt. Tosco (Mr. Son)

column3: [SHIP-BROKER] MV Maritime Champion - OPEN UAE, INT HAMRIYAH O/A 5/7 APRIL
column7:
FROM: TOSCO 

(PLS REPLY TO TOSCOSHIPPINGATGMAIL.COM <mailto:TOSCOSHIPPING@GMAIL.COM>  (PREFER) OR OPTATSHIPPING.NET.VN <mailto:OPT@SHIPPING.NET.VN> ) 

 

DEAR FRIENDS 

GOOD DAY 

 

PLS PROPOSE FIRM CARGO FOR OUR DIRECT TONNAGES ASF:

***************************** 

HOT TO FIX

=========

 

PLS PPS SUITABLE BIZ FOR

 

MV Maritime Champion - OPEN UAE, INT HAMRIYAH O/A 5/7 APRIL

 

ST bulk carrier (NOT log fitted) / built AUG 2009 / Chengxi,

Singapore flag, BV class, IMO 9527881

31,005 MT SDWT on 10.058m / TPC 42.7

LOA 176.2m / Beam 26.0m / moulded depth 14m

GRT/NRT 18,873/10,395

GR/BL 38,736.7 cbm / 36,800 cbm

 

Grain breakdown

Nbr 1. 6463.80 cbm

Nbr 2. 8417.30 cbm

Nbr 3. 8039.10 cbm

Nbr 4. 8267.90 cbm

Nbr 5. 7548.60 cbm

 

5 HH electric-hydraulic type, end folding

 

Hatch sizes

Nbr 1.  14.40m x 14.0m

Nbr 2-5 19.20m x 15.6m

 

4 x 30 MT IHI cranes

A60 bulkhead/Co2 fitted/AWWF fitted/appendix b certified

 

Laden about 13.75 kn on about 26mt IFO380cst + 0.1mt LSMGO

Ballast about 14.25 kn on about 25mt IFO380cst + 0.1mt LSMGO

 

Eco speed/consumption given in good faith as guidance wog

 

Ballast about 12.5 kn on about 20.5mt IFO380cst + 0.1mt LSMGO

Laden about 12.5 kn on about 22.5mt IFO380cst + 0.1mt LSMGO

 

Vessel to operate at full speed for at least 2 hours per day.

 

All speed/consumption basis good weather/smooth sea (no adverse currents)

upto/incl and not exceeding Beaufort scale force4 and Douglas sea state 3,

always basis clean/smooth bottom, even keel and no negative influence of swell

 

In port working: about 4.6mt IFO380cst + 0.2mt LSMGO

In port idle: about 2.6mt IFO380cst + 0.2mt LSMGO

 

Vessel has liberty to use LSMGO for manoeuvring in/out narrow waters, canals, rivers,

on entering and leaving ports and in adverse weather.

 

No mixing of bunkers between new bunkers with bunker already on board.

 

All details about

 

*****************************  

Thanks & Best Regards
Capt. Tosco (Mr. Son)

column3: [SHIP-BROKER] OPEN TONNAGE
column7:
FROM: TOSCO 

(PLS REPLY TO TOSCOSHIPPINGATGMAIL.COM <mailto:TOSCOSHIPPING@GMAIL.COM>  (PREFER) OR OPTATSHIPPING.NET.VN <mailto:OPT@SHIPPING.NET.VN> ) 

 

DEAR FRIENDS 

GOOD DAY 

 

PLS PROPOSE FIRM CARGO FOR OUR DIRECT TONNAGES ASF:

***************************** 

VOY TCT LONG P OK

 

OPEN WCI INT NAVLAKHI 20-30TH APR

 

M/V NASCO PEARL

HONGKONG FLAG,LR CLASS,2010 BLT

SUMMER DWT 56860MT BSS 12.8M

GT/NT 32987/19233

LOA/BEAM:189.99/32.26M

4*35MT CRANE ,GRAB FITTED

G/B 71,634.12/68,162.25CBM

5H/5H

 

ADA

 

//

mv Jetstream open 5-7 Apr Penang, Malaysia or 7-9 Apr Singapore.

mv Jetstream

Flag:  Malta

Port of Registry:  Valletta

Built:    June 2012

Builder:   SPP SHIPBUILDING CO.,LTD., Korea

Official No.: 9528184

IMO No.:   9528184

MMSI No.:  229 047 000

Call Sign:  9HA3024

Type of Vessel:    Bulk Carrier

Classification Society: KR

DWT: 34,562.7 MT at S.L.W.L. 9.917M (SUMMER LOAD DRAFT)

LOA/LBP/BREADTH/DEPTH (m) : 180.00/172.93/30.00/14.70

GRT/NRT: 23458/11578

Holds/Hatches: 5/5

TTL capacity (grain incl. hatch coamings): 48.700 CBM

5 holds tank top dimensions (Lm x Wm x Hm):

No.1 24,80 x 8,40(FWD)/19,80(AFT) x 13,10(Upper Deck)/15,10(Hatch Cover)

No.2 24,80 x 20,70(FWD)/22,00(AFT) x 13,10(Upper Deck)/15,10(Hatch Cover)

No.3 24,80 x 22,00 x 13,10(Upper Deck)/15,10(Hatch Cover)

No.4 24,80 x 22,00 x 13,10(Upper Deck)/15,10(Hatch Cover)

No.5 25,60 x 22,00(FWD)/12,80(AFT) x 13,10(Upper Deck)/15,10(Hatch Cover)

All cargo holds equipped with mechanical explosion proof type exhaust ventilation

(2 ventilators (each 50%) for each hold), with rate 6 air changes per hour.

-CO2 fitted: Engine room, each cargo hold.

–Ladders: Australian type.

–Strength of the tank top: No.1- 16,7 ton/m2, No2.- 14 ton/m2, No.3- 19,35 ton/m2,

No.4- 14,1 ton/m2, No.5- 18,3 ton/m2. Heavy cargoes of S.F. 12 CFT/LT (0.34 CBM/LT) in

holds Nos. 1, 3 & 5 and Nos.2 & 4 empty shall be loaded at full scantling draft

and holds Nos. 2 & 4 shall be designed for loading of S.F. 35 CBF/LT.

5 Hatch covers: Weather tight, Electro-Hydraulic Fore & Aft folding type

operated by external hydraulic cylinders.

Hatch coves top strength: No.1- 4,1 ton/m2; No. 2~5- 3,5 ton/m2

Hatch cover size (Lm x Bm)

-------------------------------

No.1 16,00 x 18,40/13,70

Nos. 2~5 19,20 x 20,20

Hatch No. & Nominal opening size (Lm x Bm)

-------- ------------------------------

No.1     16.00 x 18.20/13.50

Nos. 2~5 19.20 x 20.20

Cranes: 4 x SWL 35 MT installed in center on upper deck between each holds.

Main engine: MAN-B&W 5S50MC-C MK7. MCR 10750 BHP(7900KW) x 127 RPM

Generator engine: 3 x YANMAR 6EY18ALW x 600 KW x 900 RPM (440V, 60HZ)

M/E & G/E Fuel Oil:

-HFO RMG 380 CST/50 C in accordance with ISO 8217:2010 with Calculated Carbon

Aromaticity Index (C.C.A.I.) not exceeds 850. Fuel must not contain any used

lubricating oil or other waste chemicals.

-MGO(DMA), MDO/DMB in accordance with ISO 8217:2010 with Sulfur content according to current

Sulfur Regulations IMO, EU, California State areas and viscosity above 3 cSt at 40 degrees Celsius.

Vessel’s Speed/Bunker consumption: Sea Speed (Laden/Ballast) about 13/13,5 Knots.

Daily fuel oil consumption of Main Engine:  22 Mt/Day plus 2.0 Mt/Day GE

For maneuver: 550 kg/hr MGO(DMA), MDO/DMB - for purpose of reliable engine operation AND

in accordance with current Sulfur Regulations IMO, EU, California State areas.

The above stated speed and bunker consumption figures at sea

are stated provided the absence of (adverse) coming current and/or negative

influence of swell, i.e. when good weather conditions - wind maximum Beaufort

force 2 (up to 3.5 m/sec), calm (SWH upto 0.5 M) and deep sea and provided

vessel's underwater hull and propeller are clean from fouling.

Vessel's M/E burns MDO/DMB when maneuvering in/approaches narrow or restricted waters including canals/rivers/shallow

waters/fog conditions and also when ME/GE cold start applicable.

Bunker consumption in port:

In port w/o cargo operations – 1.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day plus Boiler consumption:

a) 1.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature above 15 degrees Celsius

b) 2.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature from 10 and upto 15degrees Celsius

c) 3.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature from 0 and upto 10 degrees Celsius

d) 5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature below 0 degrees Celsius

In port with cargo operations – 3.5 Mt HFO 380 CST per day plus Boiler consumption:

a) 1.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature above 15 degrees Celsius

b) 2.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature from 10 and upto 15degrees Celsius

c) 3.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature from 0 and upto 10 degrees Celsius

d) 5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature below 0 degrees Celsius

aga wog.

Owners’ P&I Club: JAPAN P&I CLUB.

H+M Insurance Company: Lloyds of London.

 

***************************** 

 Thanks & Best Regards
Capt. Tosco (Mr. Son)
---------------------------------------------------------------
TRUONG GIANG OCEAN SHIPPING CO.,LTD (TOSCO)

column3: [SHIP-BROKER] DD open position list 03.04.17
column7:
FROM: TOSCO  

(PLS REPLY TO TOSCOSHIPPINGATGMAIL.COM <mailto:TOSCOSHIPPING@GMAIL.COM>  (PREFER) OR OPTATSHIPPING.NET.VN <mailto:OPT@SHIPPING.NET.VN> )  

 

DEAR FRIENDS  

GOOD DAY  

PLS PROPOSE FOR:  

*****************************  

aa. mv Jetstream open 6-7 Apr Penang, Malaysia or 8-9 Apr Singapore.

bb. mv DD Vanguard open 18-22 Apr Chiba, Japan.

cc. mv DD Voyager open 8-10 Apr CJK, China.

 

 

aa. mv Jetstream

Flag:  Malta

Port of Registry:  Valletta

Built:    June 2012

Builder:   SPP SHIPBUILDING CO.,LTD., Korea

Official No.: 9528184

IMO No.:   9528184

MMSI No.:  229 047 000

Call Sign:  9HA3024

Type of Vessel:    Bulk Carrier

Classification Society: KR

DWT: 34,562.7 MT at S.L.W.L. 9.917M (SUMMER LOAD DRAFT)

LOA/LBP/BREADTH/DEPTH (m) : 180.00/172.93/30.00/14.70

GRT/NRT: 23458/11578

Holds/Hatches: 5/5

TTL capacity (grain incl. hatch coamings): 48.700 CBM

5 holds tank top dimensions (Lm x Wm x Hm):

No.1 24,80 x 8,40(FWD)/19,80(AFT) x 13,10(Upper Deck)/15,10(Hatch Cover)

No.2 24,80 x 20,70(FWD)/22,00(AFT) x 13,10(Upper Deck)/15,10(Hatch Cover)

No.3 24,80 x 22,00 x 13,10(Upper Deck)/15,10(Hatch Cover)

No.4 24,80 x 22,00 x 13,10(Upper Deck)/15,10(Hatch Cover)

No.5 25,60 x 22,00(FWD)/12,80(AFT) x 13,10(Upper Deck)/15,10(Hatch Cover)

All cargo holds equipped with mechanical explosion proof type exhaust ventilation

(2 ventilators (each 50%) for each hold), with rate 6 air changes per hour.

-CO2 fitted: Engine room, each cargo hold.

–Ladders: Australian type.

–Strength of the tank top: No.1- 16,7 ton/m2, No2.- 14 ton/m2, No.3- 19,35 ton/m2,

No.4- 14,1 ton/m2, No.5- 18,3 ton/m2. Heavy cargoes of S.F. 12 CFT/LT (0.34 CBM/LT) in

holds Nos. 1, 3 & 5 and Nos.2 & 4 empty shall be loaded at full scantling draft

and holds Nos. 2 & 4 shall be designed for loading of S.F. 35 CBF/LT.

5 Hatch covers: Weather tight, Electro-Hydraulic Fore & Aft folding type

operated by external hydraulic cylinders.

Hatch coves top strength: No.1- 4,1 ton/m2; No. 2~5- 3,5 ton/m2

Hatch cover size (Lm x Bm)

-------------------------------

No.1 16,00 x 18,40/13,70

Nos. 2~5 19,20 x 20,20

Hatch No. & Nominal opening size (Lm x Bm)

-------- ------------------------------

No.1     16.00 x 18.20/13.50

Nos. 2~5 19.20 x 20.20

Cranes: 4 x SWL 35 MT installed in center on upper deck between each holds.

Main engine: MAN-B&W 5S50MC-C MK7. MCR 10750 BHP(7900KW) x 127 RPM

Generator engine: 3 x YANMAR 6EY18ALW x 600 KW x 900 RPM (440V, 60HZ)

M/E & G/E Fuel Oil:

-HFO RMG 380 CST/50 C in accordance with ISO 8217:2010 with Calculated Carbon

Aromaticity Index (C.C.A.I.) not exceeds 850. Fuel must not contain any used

lubricating oil or other waste chemicals.

-MGO(DMA), MDO/DMB in accordance with ISO 8217:2010 with Sulfur content according to current

Sulfur Regulations IMO, EU, California State areas and viscosity above 3 cSt at 40 degrees Celsius.

Vessel’s Speed/Bunker consumption: Sea Speed (Laden/Ballast) about 13/13,5 Knots.

Daily fuel oil consumption of Main Engine:  22 Mt/Day plus 2.0 Mt/Day GE

For maneuver: 550 kg/hr MGO(DMA), MDO/DMB - for purpose of reliable engine operation AND

in accordance with current Sulfur Regulations IMO, EU, California State areas.

The above stated speed and bunker consumption figures at sea

are stated provided the absence of (adverse) coming current and/or negative

influence of swell, i.e. when good weather conditions - wind maximum Beaufort

force 2 (up to 3.5 m/sec), calm (SWH upto 0.5 M) and deep sea and provided

vessel's underwater hull and propeller are clean from fouling.

Vessel's M/E burns MDO/DMB when maneuvering in/approaches narrow or restricted waters including canals/rivers/shallow

waters/fog conditions and also when ME/GE cold start applicable.

Bunker consumption in port:

In port w/o cargo operations – 1.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day plus Boiler consumption:

a) 1.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature above 15 degrees Celsius

b) 2.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature from 10 and upto 15degrees Celsius

c) 3.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature from 0 and upto 10 degrees Celsius

d) 5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature below 0 degrees Celsius

In port with cargo operations – 3.5 Mt HFO 380 CST per day plus Boiler consumption:

a) 1.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature above 15 degrees Celsius

b) 2.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature from 10 and upto 15degrees Celsius

c) 3.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature from 0 and upto 10 degrees Celsius

d) 5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature below 0 degrees Celsius

aga wog.

Owners’ P&I Club: JAPAN P&I CLUB.

H+M Insurance Company: Lloyds of London.

The above stated speed and bunker consumption figures at sea

are stated provided the absence of (adverse) coming current and/or negative

influence of swell, i.e. when good weather conditions - wind maximum Beaufort

force 2 (up to 3.5 m/sec), calm (SWH upto 0.5 M) and deep sea and provided

vessel's underwater hull and propeller are clean from fouling. VESSEL'S M/E BURNS

MDO/DMB WHEN MANEUVERING/APPROACHING NARROWS OR RESTRICTED WATERS INCLUDING

CANALS/RIVERS/SHALLOW WATERS/STEAMING IN FOG CONDITIONS.

B) W/O CARGO OPERATIONS - 2.0 MT IFO 380 CST PER DAY

A) 1.5 MT HFO 380 CST PER DAY WHEN OUTSIDE TEMPERATURE ABOVE 15 DEGREES CELSIUS

B) 2.0 MT HFO 380 CST PER DAY WHEN OUTSIDE TEMPERATURE FROM 10 AND UPTO 15 DEGREES CELSIUS

C) 3.0 MT HFO 380 CST PER DAY WHEN OUTSIDE TEMPERATURE FROM 0 AND UPTO 10 DEGREES CELSIUS

D) 4.0 MT HFO 380 CST PER DAY WHEN OUTSIDE TEMPERATURE BELOW 0 DEGREES CELSIUS

IC,GRAB,CDE,ENV(IAFS,IOPP,ISPP,IGPP,IAPP),LI,CHA,IWS

KRM1,UMA.

For Incinerator: 100 kg/day MDO/DMB (in accordance with ISO 8217:2005) - for purpose of fuel

sludge and garbage incineration (MARPOL Annex VI).

The above stated speed and bunker consumption figures at sea

are stated provided the absence of (adverse) coming current and/or negative

column7:
FROM: TOSCO 

(PLS REPLY TO TOSCOSHIPPINGATGMAIL.COM <mailto:TOSCOSHIPPING@GMAIL.COM>  (PREFER) OR OPTATSHIPPING.NET.VN <mailto:OPT@SHIPPING.NET.VN> ) 

 

DEAR FRIENDS 

GOOD DAY 

 

PLS PROPOSE FIRM CARGO FOR OUR DIRECT TONNAGES ASF:

*****************************

Please propose suitable shipments for our own vessels as below:

 

1- Mv Hai phong 06 – 24,100 DWCC, Rvt.

2- Mv Hai phong 08 – 27,800 DWCC, Rvt

3- Mv Hai phong 19 – 27,800 DWCC, Open at HCMc area 03-06 May

4- Mv Hai phong 20 – 27,800 DWCC, Open HCMc area 02-05 May

5- Mv Hai phong 25 – 29,200 DWCC, Open Singapore range area 25th May

6. Mv Hai phong 26 – 27,500 DWCC, Open at Fuzhou, China 5-10 May

 

1. MV HAIPHONG 06 (DWT 24,835MT)

BLT 1984; Flg: Vietnam; Class: VR; IMO: 8323654; Single deck/General cargo.

Loa / Lbp / b.max / d / draft : 160/  150/  25/  12,280/  10.00

Pls offer suitable business for our tonnage below :

 

OPEN SEMARANG, INDONESIA 5TH APRIL

CAN TRY S.PERIOD ABT. 3/5M

 

 

VESSEL : MV GLORIOUS SUNSHINE - .

 

Single deck self-trimming log/bulk carrier 

Built January 2009 at Imabari Shipbuilding Co Ltd , Japan. 

Flag : Panama 

Class: NK 

Dwt / Dft / TPC ( Summer)        28,306 dwt on 9.819 m / 39.6 

Dwt / Dft  ( Lumber )                29,026dwtt on 10.118 m 

Loa/Beam:                         169.30m / 27.20m 

Grt/Nrt:                         17,018/abt 10,104 tons 

Ho/Ha:                                 5/5 

Gears:                                 4 sets x 30.5 mt Deck Crane. 

Cubics(cbm) in main holds 

Capacity of Grain/Bale : 37,303.55 m3 /35,724.49 m3 

Holdwise breakdown: 

No.1         5,309.95 m³ / 5,015.38 m3 

No.2         8,144.14 m³ / 7,827.15 m3 

No.3         8,195.48 m³ / 7,878.38 m3 

No.4         8,219.73 m³ / 7,878.38 m3 

No.5         7,434.25 m / 7,125.20 m3 

 

Folding type hatch covers 

Hatch size: L x B 

No.1: 13.60m x 16.00m 

No.2 5: 19.20m x 17.60m 

 

Tanktop strengths  1&3: 16.88 mt/m2   2&4: 15mt/m2   5 :17.01mt/m² 

Lashing material on board not for charterers use unless specifically agreed in 

c/p. 

 

Speed / Consumption: In good weather conditions up to BF4 and DSS 3 and no 

negative swell / no adverse current. 

Ballast: abt 13.80 k on abt 22.0mt IFO + abt 0.1 mt MDO / day 

Laden:   abt 13.30 k on abt 22.0mt  IFO + abt 0.1 mt MDO / day 

 

Port consumption         

Idle: abt  1.5 mt IFO + abt 0.75  mt MDO / day 

Working: abt  3.0  mt IFO + abt  1.75  mt MDO / day 

 

Bunker grade: ISO 8217:2005 Category ISO-F- RMG 380 FOR IFO AND DMA FOR MDO 

Seperate stems to be kept in seperate tanks and no co mingling of bunkers. 

Vsl has liberty to use mdo for manouvering in narrow waters, canals, 

rivers,starting/stopping engines and on entering/leaving ports and in adverse 

weather or low generator load . 

Vsl also has liberty to use mdo in her generators/auxiliary engines when 

required by local regulations. 

 

Grain Fitted        Yes 

Log fitted & full lashing materials        Yes 

All details about given in good faith 

 

ECO SPEED WOG BSS GUIDANCE ONLY: 13/12 on 16mt + 0.1 mt wog

 

 

Best Regards,  yh

MGO is required, inter alia, in navigating confined waters, estuairies, manoeuvring anchorages and when entering or leaving port, etc or

cleaning holds or when ballast is required to be changed at sea due to any regulations, ballast exchange in port, and when main engine

is running on reduced speed and/or revolutions.

Charterers always to ensure sufficient safety margin of bunkers, to the Masters satisfaction.

 

Whilst vessel is on 12.5 kts “eco”, the main engine load has to be brought up once a day to 80 % MCR for about one hour in order to remove deposits from exhaust gas duct, ie, from main engine exhaust gas collector, main engine turbo charger, exhaust gas boiler.

 

END

 WAVE (WIND SEA AND SWELL) HEIGHT CONFINED TO LIMITS OF DOUCLAS SEA

 STATE 3 (0.50-1.25 MTRS) AND WITH NO ADVERSE CURRENTS AND NO ADVERSE

 CURRENT FACTOR AND OR NEGATIVE INFLUENCE OF SWELL.

 ALWAYS EXCUDING TIMES WHEN SAILING WITH REDUCED RPM/SPEED DUE TO

 CHARTERERS' ORDERS, POOR VISIBILITY AND OTHER REASONS OF SAFETY AND

 ANY ADVERSE NAVIGATION CONDITIONS AND WHEN APPROACHING LEAVING PILOT

 STATIONS AND PORTS, MANEUVERING OR SAILING IN TRAFFIC SEPARATION

 SCHEMES (TSS), CANALS, RIVERS, NARROW OR SHALLOW OR RESTRICTED

 WATERS.

 

 L:ABT 13.0 KN ON ABT 30.0 MT IFO380 + ABT 0.1 MT MDO(DMB) PDAY

 B:ABT 14.0 KN ON ABT 30.0 MT IFO380 + ABT 0.1 MT MDO(DMB) PDAY

 ALTERNATIVE SPEDD/CONS:

 L:ABT 12.0 KN ON ABT 24.5 MT IFO380 + ABT 0.1 MT MDO(DMB) PDAY

 B:ABT 12.5 KN ON ABT 23.5 MT IFO380 + ABT 0.1 MT MDO(DMB) PDAY

 

 IN PORT

 -IDLE: ABT 3.5 MT IFO380 CST + ABT 0.1 MT MDO(DMB) PDAY

 -CRANES WORKING: ABT 5.5 MT IFO380 + ABT 0.1 MT MDO(DMB) PDAY

 VSL BURN MDO WHEN MANOUVERING IN/OUT PORTS/CANALS/RIVERS/SRAITS/

 SHALLOW WATERS OR WHEN NAVIGATES IN RESTRICTED WATERS WITH OR

 WITHOUT PILOT TO MASTER`S DISCRETION AS WELL AS WHEN

 BALLASTING/DE-BALLASTING.

 

 VSL MAY BURN UP TO +1 MT IFO PER DAY WHEN BALLASTING/DE-BALLASTING

 AND OR CARGO HOLDS CLEANING.

 

 BIMCO BUNKER FUEL SULPHUR CONTENT CLAUSE FOR TIME CHARTER PARTIES

 2005 AND ANY AMENDMENTS THERETO TO APPLY. MARPOL ANNEX VI CLAUSE

 AND ANY AMENDMENTS, TO BE INCORPORATED IN THE C/P.

 FUEL SPECS: RMG 380 ISO 8217; 2010.

 MDO SPECS: DMB ISO 8217; 2010.

 ALL DTLS ABT

 

 

Thanks  

Best Regards 

YH

Grabs 4 x 14 cbm smag-peiner electro-hydraulic type.

Cranes/grabs designed to operate within the designated capacities and cargo

densities only with no significant movement of the ship due to wave action and conditions to be less

than beaufort force 2,douglas seastate 1. No cargo loading on hatch covers or on deck

Service speed:

Ballast abt 14 kts /laden abt 13.5 kts on abt 32 mts/day ifo + abt 0.2 mts

mdo/day.

eco speed

Ballast abt 12 kts /laden abt 11.5 kts on abt 26 mts/day ifo + abt 0.2 mts

mdo/day.

 

Cons in port idle abt 3.80 mts ifo/day + abt 0.2 mts mdo/day

working/ballasting/deballasting abt 5.80 mts ifo/day + abt 0.2 mts mdo/day.

word “abt” stands for +/- 0.5 knot on speed and +/- 5% on ifo/mdo consumptions.

 

Speed/cons up to bf4/dss3, up to swell/sea height/sign wave max 1.25m, provided

no negative effects of currents or swell and no hull fouling during current voyage due to

extended stays in port or anchorage (combined 25 days max).

Positive current shall not be used in diminishing vessel’s performance.

All figures given bss full sea days only (exceeding 24hrs) and as an average of all days sea

pilot to sea pilot.

Vsl has the option to burn mgo when entering/leaving port, when maneuvering and

in narrow, shallow or congested waters, rivers, straits, canals, when ballasting/deballasting or

heating fuel in cold climates.

Mgo spec: iso 8217:2010 dma

 SPEED/CONSUMPTION:

 SPEED AND CONSUMPTIONS ARE GIVEN AT OPEN SEA BASIS SEABUOY TO

 SEABUOY AND IN GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS UP TO AND INCLUDING BEAUFORT

 WIND SCALE 4 (11-16 KNS) AND OR TOTAL COMBINED SIGNIFICANT TOTAL

 WAVE (WIND SEA AND SWELL) HEIGHT CONFINED TO LIMITS OF DOUCLAS SEA

 STATE 3 (0.50-1.25 MTRS) AND WITH NO ADVERSE CURRENTS AND NO ADVERSE

 CURRENT FACTOR AND OR NEGATIVE INFLUENCE OF SWELL.

 ALWAYS EXCUDING TIMES WHEN SAILING WITH REDUCED RPM/SPEED DUE TO

 CHARTERERS' ORDERS, POOR VISIBILITY AND OTHER REASONS OF SAFETY AND

 ANY ADVERSE NAVIGATION CONDITIONS AND WHEN APPROACHING LEAVING PILOT

 STATIONS AND PORTS, MANEUVERING OR SAILING IN TRAFFIC SEPARATION

 SCHEMES (TSS), CANALS, RIVERS, NARROW OR SHALLOW OR RESTRICTED

 WATERS.

 IN PORT

 -IDLE: ABT 3.5 MT IFO380 CST + ABT 0.1 MT MDO(DMB) PDAY

 -CRANES WORKING: ABT 5.5 MT IFO380 + ABT 0.1 MT MDO(DMB) PDAY

 VSL BURN MDO WHEN MANOUVERING IN/OUT PORTS/CANALS/RIVERS/SRAITS/

 SHALLOW WATERS OR WHEN NAVIGATES IN RESTRICTED WATERS WITH OR

 WITHOUT PILOT TO MASTER`S DISCRETION AS WELL AS WHEN

 BALLASTING/DE-BALLASTING.

 

 VSL MAY BURN UP TO +1 MT IFO PER DAY WHEN BALLASTING/DE-BALLASTING

 AND OR CARGO HOLDS CLEANING.

 

 BIMCO BUNKER FUEL SULPHUR CONTENT CLAUSE FOR TIME CHARTER PARTIES

no negative effects of currents or swell and no hull fouling during current voyage due to

extended stays in port or anchorage (combined 25 days max).

Positive current shall not be used in diminishing vessel’s performance.

All figures given bss full sea days only (exceeding 24hrs) and as an average of all days sea

pilot to sea pilot.

Vsl has the option to burn mgo when entering/leaving port, when maneuvering and

in narrow, shallow or congested waters, rivers, straits, canals, when ballasting/deballasting or

heating fuel in cold climates.

SPEED/CONSUMPTION IS IN GOOD WEATHER/SMOOTH SEAS AND UNDERSTOOD TO MEAN ALL WEATHER CONDITIONS 

NOT EXCEEDING FORCE BEAUFORT SCALE 4 AND DOUGLAS SEA STATE 3 WITH NO ADVERSE CURRENT.

 

VSL'S M/E MAY BURN MDO/MGO A/O EXTRA IFO IN CASE OF EMERGENCY OR WHILE NAVIGATING/MANOUVERING 

IN NARROW/SHALLOW/RESTRICTED WATERS, CANALS, RIVERS, ENTERING/LEAVING PORTS/CANALS, STARTING/STOPPING 

THE ENGINE, BALLAST WATER EXCHANGING, CLEANING VSL’S HOLDS, BALLASTING/DEBALLASTING OPERATION, OR BAD/COLD 

WEATHER CONDITION ETC ALWAYS ATH THE DISCRETION OF THE MASTER.

 

FOR VESSEL’S ECO SPEED/CONS, IN GOOD FAITH N WOG :  

 

- AVERAGE LADEN/BALLAST ABT 12.00 / ABT 12.50 KTS ON ABT 18.30MT / 17.50MT OF IFO PER DAY.

(ABOUT MEANS 0.5KTS FOR SPEED AND 5% FOR BUNKER CONSUMPTION).

SPEED/CONSUMPTION IS IN GOOD WEATHER/SMOOTH SEAS AND UNDERSTOOD TO MEAN ALL WEATHER CONDITIONS NOT 

EXCEEDING FORCE BEAUFORT SCALE 4 AND DOUGLAS SEA STATE 3 WITH NO ADVERSE CURRENT.

 

ALL DETAILS ABOUT

 

 BRGS  YH

KRM1 -UMA STCM

GRT/NRT: 23453/11522
Holds/Hatches: 5/5
TTL capacity (grain incl. hatch coaming): 48765,8 CBM Holds tank top
dimensions (Lm x Wm x Hm): 
No.1 24,80 x 8,40(FWD)/19,80(AFT) x 13,10(Upper Deck)/15,10(Hatch Cover)
No.2 24,80 x 20,70(FWD)/22,00(AFT) x 13,10(Upper Deck)/15,10(Hatch Cover)
No.3 24,80 x 22,00 x 13,10(Upper Deck)/15,10(Hatch Cover)

No.5 25,60 x 22,00(FWD)/13,00(AFT) x 13,10(Upper Deck)/15,10(Hatch Cover)

All cargo holds equipped with mechanical explosion proof type exhaust
ventilation
(2 ventilators (each 50%) for each hold), with rate 6 air changes per hour. 
-CO2 fitted: Engine room, each cargo hold. 
-Ladders: Australian type. 
-Strength of the tank top: No.1- 17 ton/m2, No2.- 14 ton/m2, No.3- 17
ton/m2,
No.4- 14 ton/m2, No.5- 17 ton/m2.
Heavy cargoes of S.F. 12 CFT/LT (0.34 CBM/LT) in holds Nos. 1, 3 & 5 and
Nos.2 & 4 empty may be loaded at full scantling draft and holds Nos.2 & 4
designed for loading of S.F. 35CFT/LT. 
5 Hatch covers: MACGREGOR, weather tight, electro-hydraulic fore & aft
folding type, operated by external hydraulic cylinders.
Hatch coves top strength: 2,5 ton/m2
Hatch cover size (Lm x Bm)
-------------------------------
No.1 16,70 x 14,00/18,70
Nos. 2~5 19,50 x 20,50

Hatch No. & Nominal opening size (Lm x Bm)
-------- ------------------------------
No.1 16.40 x 13.70/18.40
Nos. 2~5 19.20 x 20.20

Cranes: 4 x SWL 35 MT, MACGREGOR, installed in center on upper deck between
each holds.
Main engine: MAN-B&W 5S50MC-C MK7. MCR 10750 BHP x 127 RPM Generator engine:
3 x YANMAR 6EY18AL x 600 KW x 900 RPM, 440V, 60HZ M/E & G/E Fuel Oil:
-HFO RMG35 380 CST/50 C in accordance with ISO 8217:2010 with Calculated
Carbon Aromaticity Index (C.C.A.I.) not exceeds 850. Fuel must not contain
any used lubricating oil or other waste chemicals. 
-MGO(DMA), MDO(DMB) in accordance with ISO 8217:2010 with Sulfur content
according to current Sulfur Regulations IMO, EU, California State areas and
viscosity above 3 cSt at 40 degrees Celsius. 
Vessel's Speed/Bunker consumption (assumption):
Sea Speed (laden/ballast) about 13/13,5 Knots.
Daily fuel oil consumption of Main Engine appx. 22.0 Mt/Day plus 2.0 Mt/Day
GE For maneuver: appx. 600 kg/hr MGO(DMA), MDO/DMB - for purpose of reliable
engine operation and in accordance with current Sulphur Regulations IMO, EU,
California State areas.
The above stated speed and bunker consumption figures at sea are stated
provided the absence of (adverse) coming current and/or negative influence
of swell, i.e. when good weather conditions - wind maximum Beaufort force 2
(up to 3.5 m/sec), calm (SWH upto 0.5 M) and deep sea and provided vessel's
underwater hull and propeller are clean from fouling. 
Vessel's M/E burns MGO(DMA), MDO(DMB)
when maneuvering in/approaches narrow or restricted waters including
canals/rivers/shallow waters/fog conditions and also when ME/GE cold start
applicable.
Bunker consumption in port:
In port w/o cargo operations - 1.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day plus Boiler
consumption:
a) 1.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature above 15 degrees
Celsius
b) 2.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature from 10 and upto
15degrees Celsius
c) 3.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature from 0 and upto 10
degrees Celsius
d) 5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature below 0 degrees Celsius
In port with cargo operations - 3.5 Mt HFO 380 CST per day plus Boiler
consumption:
a) 1.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature above 15 degrees
Celsius
b) 2.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature from 10 and upto
15degrees Celsius
c) 3.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature from 0 and upto 10
degrees Celsius
d) 5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature below 0 degrees Celsius
Owners P & I club: JAPAN P & I CLUB
H+M Insurance Company: Lloyds,London
Ada wog.

All cargo holds equipped with mechanical explosion proof type exhaust
ventilation
(2 ventilators (each 50%) for each hold), with rate 6 air changes per hour. 
-CO2 fitted: Engine room, each cargo hold. 
-Ladders: Australian type. 
-Strength of the tank top: No.1- 17 ton/m2, No2.- 14 ton/m2, No.3- 17
ton/m2,
No.4- 14 ton/m2, No.5- 17 ton/m2.
Heavy cargoes of S.F. 12 CFT/LT (0.34 CBM/LT) in holds Nos. 1, 3 & 5 and
Nos.2 & 4 empty may be loaded at full scantling draft and holds Nos.2 & 4
designed for loading of S.F. 35CFT/LT. 
5 Hatch covers: MACGREGOR, weather tight, electro-hydraulic fore & aft
folding type, operated by external hydraulic cylinders.
Hatch coves top strength: 2,5 ton/m2
Hatch cover size (Lm x Bm)
-------------------------------
No.1 16,70 x 14,00/18,70
Nos. 2~5 19,50 x 20,50

Hatch No. & Nominal opening size (Lm x Bm)
-------- ------------------------------
No.1 16.40 x 13.70/18.40
Nos. 2~5 19.20 x 20.20

Cranes: 4 x SWL 35 MT, MACGREGOR, installed in center on upper deck between
each holds.
Main engine: MAN-B&W 5S50MC-C MK7. MCR 10750 BHP x 127 RPM Generator engine:
3 x YANMAR 6EY18AL x 600 KW x 900 RPM, 440V, 60HZ M/E & G/E Fuel Oil:
-HFO RMG35 380 CST/50 C in accordance with ISO 8217:2010 with Calculated
Carbon Aromaticity Index (C.C.A.I.) not exceeds 850. Fuel must not contain
any used lubricating oil or other waste chemicals. 
-MGO(DMA), MDO(DMB) in accordance with ISO 8217:2010 with Sulfur content
according to current Sulfur Regulations IMO, EU, California State areas and
viscosity above 3 cSt at 40 degrees Celsius. 
Vessel's Speed/Bunker consumption (assumption):
Sea Speed (laden/ballast) about 13/13,5 Knots.
Daily fuel oil consumption of Main Engine appx. 22.0 Mt/Day plus 2.0 Mt/Day
GE For maneuver: appx. 600 kg/hr MGO(DMA), MDO/DMB - for purpose of reliable
engine operation and in accordance with current Sulphur Regulations IMO, EU,
California State areas.
The above stated speed and bunker consumption figures at sea are stated
provided the absence of (adverse) coming current and/or negative influence
of swell, i.e. when good weather conditions - wind maximum Beaufort force 2
(up to 3.5 m/sec), calm (SWH upto 0.5 M) and deep sea and provided vessel's
underwater hull and propeller are clean from fouling. 
Vessel's M/E burns MGO(DMA), MDO(DMB)
when maneuvering in/approaches narrow or restricted waters including
canals/rivers/shallow waters/fog conditions and also when ME/GE cold start
applicable.
Bunker consumption in port:
In port w/o cargo operations - 1.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day plus Boiler
consumption:
a) 1.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature above 15 degrees
Celsius
b) 2.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature from 10 and upto
15degrees Celsius
c) 3.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature from 0 and upto 10
degrees Celsius
d) 5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature below 0 degrees Celsius
In port with cargo operations - 3.5 Mt HFO 380 CST per day plus Boiler
consumption:
a) 1.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature above 15 degrees
Celsius
b) 2.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature from 10 and upto
15degrees Celsius
c) 3.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature from 0 and upto 10
degrees Celsius
d) 5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature below 0 degrees Celsius
Owners P & I club: JAPAN P & I CLUB
H+M Insurance Company: Lloyds,London

Cranes: 4 x SWL 35 MT, MACGREGOR, installed in center on upper deck between each holds.

Main engine: MAN-B&W 5S50MC-C MK7. MCR 10750 BHP x 127 RPM

Generator engine: 3 x YANMAR 6EY18AL x 600 KW x 900 RPM, 440V, 60HZ 

M/E & G/E Fuel Oil:

-HFO RMG35 380 CST/50 C in accordance with ISO 8217:2010 with Calculated Carbon Aromaticity Index (C.C.A.I.) 

not exceeds 850. Fuel must not contain any used lubricating oil or other waste chemicals. 

-MGO(DMA), MDO(DMB) in accordance with ISO 8217:2010 with Sulfur content according to current Sulfur Regulations IMO,

EU, California State areas and viscosity above 3 cSt at 40 degrees Celsius. 

Vessel’s Speed/Bunker consumption (assumption):

Sea Speed (laden/ballast) about 13/13,5 Knots.

Daily fuel oil consumption of Main Engine appx. 22.0 Mt/Day plus 2.0 Mt/Day GE

For maneuver: appx. 600 kg/hr MGO(DMA), MDO/DMB - for purpose of reliable engine operation and in accordance 

with current Sulphur Regulations IMO, EU, California State areas.

The above stated speed and bunker consumption figures at sea 

are stated provided the absence of (adverse) coming current and/or negative 

influence of swell, i.e. when good weather conditions - wind maximum Beaufort

force 2 (up to 3.5 m/sec), calm (SWH upto 0.5 M) and deep sea and provided

vessel's underwater hull and propeller are clean from fouling. 

Vessel's M/E burns MGO(DMA), MDO(DMB) 

when maneuvering in/approaches narrow or restricted waters including canals/rivers/shallow 

waters/fog conditions and also when ME/GE cold start applicable.

Bunker consumption in port:

In port w/o cargo operations – 1.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day plus Boiler consumption:

a) 1.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature above 15 degrees Celsius

b) 2.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature from 10 and upto 15degrees Celsius

c) 3.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature from 0 and upto 10 degrees Celsius

d) 5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature below 0 degrees Celsius

In port with cargo operations – 3.5 Mt HFO 380 CST per day plus Boiler consumption:

a) 1.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature above 15 degrees Celsius

b) 2.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature from 10 and upto 15degrees Celsius

c) 3.5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature from 0 and upto 10 degrees Celsius

d) 5 MT HFO 380 CST per day when outside temperature below 0 degrees Celsius

Owners P & I club: JAPAN P & I CLUB

H+M Insurance Company: Lloyds,London

open huanghua, n.china abt 18 april

bod abt 950 ifo/150 lsmgo

can do trips, nopac rv, aust rv etc

 

 

STAR CRIMSON, PAN FLG BLT 2016 at Imabari

61.298 MTDWT ON 13.01M SSW

TPC 61.4, FWA 29.4 CM, BOTH AT SDRAFT

LOA 199.98M/BM 32.24M

5 HO/5 HA, FOLDING TYPE HACOVERS, 77.674 CBM GRN/73.551 CBM BALE

VSL STR FOR CARRIAGE OF HVY CRGS HO 2&4 MAY BE EMPTY

AHL, CO2 IN HOLDS, A60 BULKHEAD

4 CRANES OF 30.5 MT  + 4 GRABS 12 CBM / REDUCABLE TO 6 CBM

SPEED/CONS ABT 14.5 B/ 14 L ON ABT 28.5 MT IFO

ALL ABOVE UNDER GOOD WEATHER CONDITION AND SMOOTH SEA UPTO AND INCLUDING

B4/DOUGLAS SEA STATE 3 WITH NO ADVERSE CURRENT/SWELL

ECO SPEED WITHOUT GTEE ABT 12 L/12.5 B ON ABT 22 MT IFO

VSL CONSUMES MDO/MGO WHILST MANEOUVERING IN CONFINED WTRS AND IN PORT

IN PORT IDLE ABT 2,5 MT IFO, IN PORT WORKING ABT 4,5 MT IFO

BUNKER STANDARD: ISO 8217:2010

IF CHRTRS ELECT TO STEAM AT ECO SPEED, OWNERS RESERVE THE

RIGHT TO SPEED UP AT LEAST 1 HOUR PER 24 HRS TO "CLEAN OUT

THE SYSTEMS"

VSL BURNS IFO OR MDO OR MGO WHEN ENGINE ON STAND BY, WHEN DEAD SLOW, WHEN STARTING BALLASTING OR DE-BALLASTING, WHEN MANEUVERING IN/OUT PORTS/CANALS/RIVERS/STRAITS/SHALLOW WATERS, WHEN NAVIGATES IN RESTRICTED WATERS, WITH OR WITHOUT PILOT TO MASTER'S DISCRETION

Laden - abt 14 on abt 31.5 mt/day + mdo abt 0.1 mt/day

In Port Idle/Working - abt 2.8 + 0.3mdo / abt 4.8 + 0.3mdo

 

Eco speed/cons (gteed)

Ballast - abt 12knots on abt 19 mt/day + 0.1mt/day mdo

Laden - abt 12.2knots on abt 20.9 mt/day + 0.1mt/day mdo

 

ALL SPEED AND CONSUMPTION FIGURES ARE AVERAGE FIGURES DURING C/P

PERIOD. ALL SPEED AND ALL CONSUMPTION FIGURES ARE TO BE CONSIDERED

AS 'ABOUT'WOG. AT SEA PERFORMANCE FIGURES ARE CONSIDERED TO BE FROM

SEABUOY TO SEABUOY IN MODERATE WEATHER UPTO/INCLUDING BEAFORT 4.DOUGLAS SEA STATE 3 (1,25 M),

NOT IN ADVERSE CURRENT AND NO NEGATIVE INFLUENCE OF SWELL

MARPOL ANNEX VI CLAUSE TO BE INCORPORATED IN CP.

 

IFO 380 CST CLASS RMG 380 MAX SULPHUR CONTENT 3,50% /  DIESEL CLASS DMA / BOTH AS PER ISO 8217, 2010 OR LATEST EDITION.

NO USED LUBRICANTS TO BE PRESENT IN FUEL

NO COMINGLING OF DIFFERENT FUEL BATCHES IN TANKS ALLOWED

The word " abt " in speed and consumption refers to an allowance of minus

0.5knts on speed and plus 5% on bunker consumption respectively both in owners favor.

The aforesaid speed/consumption are basis good weather/smooth sea, up to

max BF SC 4/Douglas Sea State 3, no adverse currents, no negative

influence of swell, even keel  condition, at the condition of clean bottom in open, calm and

deep sea condition with minimum 48 hrs steaming time.

Any gain on time and/or consumption to be off-set against loss on time and/or consumption if any.

No favourable weather and current factor to be applied when evaluating vessel’s performance

Vessel shall have liberty of using diesel oil whilst entering and

leaving ports and for exchange of ballast, maneuvering in shallow

waters, channels and narrow waterways, poor visibility, heavy traffic,

working with low load, frequent load change, shift of generator engines.

 

ALL FIGS ALL ABT

LADEN ABT 13.8KT ABT 33.0 MT IFO INCLD AUX /DAY

The word " abt " in speed and consumption refers to an allowance of minus

0.5knts on speed and plus 5% on bunker consumption respectively both in owners favor.

The aforesaid speed/consumption are basis good weather/smooth sea, up to

max BF SC 4/Douglas Sea State 3, no adverse currents, no negative

influence of swell, even keel  condition, at the condition of clean bottom in open, calm and

deep sea condition with minimum 48 hrs steaming time.

Any gain on time and/or consumption to be off-set against loss on time and/or consumption if any.

No favourable weather and current factor to be applied when evaluating vessel’s performance

Vessel shall have liberty of using diesel oil whilst entering and

leaving ports and for exchange of ballast, maneuvering in shallow

waters, channels and narrow waterways, poor visibility, heavy traffic,

working with low load, frequent load change, shift of generator engines.

 

ALL FIGS ALL ABT

DNV CLASS

Loa 199.9  m / beam 32,26 m 

GT/NR 36,332 / 21,633

5 ho / ha 

78,750 cbm Grain 100 pct trimmed end

4 x 30 MT SWL cranes ,  4 x 12 cbm grabs 

A60 bulkhead / CO2 fitted 

 

AT SEA

BALLAST ABT 14.0 KT ABT 30.0 MT IFO INCLD AUX/DAY , 

LADEN ABT 13.8KT ABT 33.0 MT IFO INCLD AUX /DAY 

 

ECO SPEED CHTRS REFERENCE ONLY WOG:

BALLAST:  ABT 12.0 KNOTS ON ABT 19.5 MT IFO INCLD AUX /DAY

LADEN:  ABT 11.5 KNOTS ON ABT 21.5 MT IFO INCLD AUX /DAY

 

PORT IDLE/WORKING ABT 3.5 MT IFO/ABT5.50 MT IFO /DAY

 

VSL ALLOWED TO USE ABT 0.1 MT / DAY OF MGO WHEN USING INCINERATOR.

Ballast operation at sea and cleaning of holds vsl to consume abt 1,5 mt ifo extra 

 

The word " abt " in speed and consumption refers to an allowance of minus

0.5knts on speed and plus 5% on bunker consumption respectively both in owners favor.

The aforesaid speed/consumption are basis good weather/smooth sea, up to

max BF SC 4/Douglas Sea State 3, no adverse currents, no negative

influence of swell, even keel  condition, at the condition of clean bottom in open, calm and

deep sea condition with minimum 48 hrs steaming time.

Any gain on time and/or consumption to be off-set against loss on time and/or consumption if any.

No favourable weather and current factor to be applied when evaluating vessel’s performance

Vessel shall have liberty of using diesel oil whilst entering and

leaving ports and for exchange of ballast, maneuvering in shallow

waters, channels and narrow waterways, poor visibility, heavy traffic,

working with low load, frequent load change, shift of generator engines.

 

ALL FIGS ALL ABT

EFTICHIA   -   open GIB spot

built / delivered : 2011

 

tonnage gross /net : 22,419 / 11,607

breadth/depth moulded: 30.00 meters / 14.40 meters

 

summer dwt/drafts : 34,125 mt / 9.916 meters

 

winter dwt/drafts : 33,132 mt / 9.710 meters

 

fresh dwt/drafts : 34,131 mt / 10.138 meters

 

tropical dwt/drafts : 35,121 mt / 10.122 meters

 

t. fresh dwt/drafts : 35,105 mt / 10.344 meters

 

fresh water allowance : 222 mm

 

tpc at summer dwt : 48.3

 

 

 

 

hold capacities:

 

capacity grain capacity bale

 

hold #1: 7,791.25 cu. metres 275,145.40 cu. feet 7,361.08 cu. metres

 

hold #2: 9,941.72 cu. metres 351,088.53 cu. feet 9,499.68 cu. metres

 

hold #3: 9,600.68 cu. metres 339,044.81 cu. feet 9,196.33 cu. metres

 

hold #4: 9,942.20 cu. metres 351,105.48 cu. feet 9,499.90 cu. metres

 

hold #5: 9,312.00 cu. metres 328,850.18 cu. feet 8,969.21 cu. metres

 

total: 46,587.85 cu. metres 1,645,234.40 cu. feet 44,526.20 cu. metres

 

 

 

 

gears: electrohydraulic wmmp (ihi) cranes, located between h/c 1/2, 2/3, 3/4

 

& 4/5.

 

capacities: 4 x 30 mt - hook operations

 

4 x 24 mt - grab operations

 

no grabs onboard, however grabs can be used on vessel's crane.

 

tandem operation is not allowed.

 

length of boom: 28.85 m

 

crane outreach: 11.00 meters at 25 degrees

 

min/max working radius: 4.5 m - 26 m

 

slewing speed: 0.55 rpm

 

hoisting speed: 20m/min

 

luffing speed: 46 seconds

 

onboard electrical supply (v/hz): 220v-440 v/60hz

 

 

 

 

speed and consumption: below figures are given on good weather conditions

 

basis of wind speed not exceeding beaufort scale 4 & douglas sea state 3

 

with no adverse current and no negative influence of swell. the word "about"

 

shall mean ± 0.5 knots for the speed and ± 5% mt for the consumption. 

 

 

 

 

full service speed:

 

laden : abt 14.00 kts on abt 25.20 mt 

 

h/ballast: abt 14.00 kts on abt 23.80 

 

l/ballast : abt 14.00 kts on abt 23.00 

 

 

 

 

economical speed:

 

laden : abt 13.00 kts on abt 22.00 mt 

 

h/ballast: abt 13.00 kts on abt 21.20 mt 

 

l/ballast : abt 13.00 kts on abt 20.50 mt 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

the vessel shall have the liberty to use lsmgo for manoeuvring in and out of

 

ports, starting of a/e and boiler, navigating in

 

shallow/restricted/congested waters, canals and rivers. the vessel can

 

consume lsmgo 0.1% when same it is required by marpol or local regulations.

 

 

 

 

port consumptions:

 

idle : abt 2.30 mt hfo rmg380 per 24 hrs for a/e (d/g).

 

cargo gear working: abt 4.00 mt hfo rmg380 per 24 hrs for a/e (d/g).

 

 

 

 

additional consumptions for:

 

boiler in ports/roads : abt 1.5 mt hfo rmg380 per 24 hrs

 

ballasting or de-ballasting: abt 2.0 mt hfo rmg380 per operation.

 

cargo holds washing : abt 1.5 mt hfo rmg380 per 24 hrs

 

fuel specifications: vessel consumes iso 8217:2010 specs or better,

 

of which are applicable for fuel oil and diesel/gas oil. however,

 

charterers can supply iso 8217:2005 specs, where 2010 specs are not

 

available.

 

 

 

 

water line to top of hatch coamings below ballast conditions, basis 50%

 

bunkers:

 

distance from waterline to top of hatch covers: no.1 hatch midships no.5

 

hatch

 

normal ballast condition: (c.h. not flooded) 12.30 metres 11.40 metres 10.50

 

metres

 

full ballast condition: (c.h. flooded) 9.40 metres 9.10 metres 8.90 metres

 

light condition: 15.60 metres 13.80 metres 12.40 metres

 

fully laden condition: 6.40 metres 6.40 metres 6.40 metres

 

distance from keel to top of hatch coamings 16.32 metres 16.32 metres 16.32

 

metres.

 

 

 

 

steel coils : 20.00 tons [(l) 1.5m x (d) 1.5m] x 2 tiers with 4 dunnages.

 

tank top strength : 25.00 t/m2 uniform load at each hold.

 

 

 

 

upper decks : 2.50 t/m² - inside line of hatch openings

 

4.10 t/m² - outside line of hatch opening within ¼ l from the fore

 

3.50 t/m² - outside line of hatch opening at other areas.

 

alternative loading : hold no. 2 and hold no.4 may be empty.

 

co2 fitting in holds : yes, fitted

 

australian ladders : yes, fitted

 

holds ventilation : yes, mechanical and/or natural

 

cement holes: 4 x 720 mm

 

ballast pumps: 2 x 700 m3/hour

Michael

MV THOR ENTERPRISE  open ALIAGA O/A 21ST-22ND APRIL 

SINGAPORE FLAG BLT 95 

SDBC/OHBS 

42,529 SDWT ON 11.535 M TPC 49.1 

8 HOLDS/8 HATCHES 

GR/BL 51,035 / 49,818 

GRD 4 X 30 MTC 

LOA/BM 184.93 / 30.50 M 

GRT/NRT 25,676 / 13,991 

PNI: WEST OF ENGLAND 

CLASS: DNV-GL 

CO2 FITTED 

 

ABT 14.0/13.0 KN B/L ON ABT 27/28 MTS IFO + ABT 0.1 MTS MDO 

IN PORT IDLE: ABT 3.0 MTS IFO 

WRKG: ABT 4.0 MTS IFO 

 

ECO SPEED GIVEN IN FAITH BUT WOG 

ABT 12.5/12.0 KN B/L ON ABT 21.5 MTS IFO + ABT 0.1 MTS MDO 

 

WHEN ORDERED ECO SPEED, THEN OWNERS HAVE RIGHT FOR VESSEL TO 

PROCEED AT REGULAR SPEED FOR 1 HOUR EVERYDAY IN ORDER TO BLOW OUT 

EXCESS EXHAUST/CARBON DEPOSIT TO PREVENT EFFECTIVE DAMAGE TO MAIN 

ENGINE COMPONENTS 

 

SPEED AND CONSUMPTION FIGURES ARE ABOUT" WHICH IS APPLICABLE 

TO BOTH AND JOINTLY TO SPEED AND CONSUMPTION (MEANING SPECIFICALLY 

0.5 KTS FOR SPEED AND 5% FOR CONSUMPTION), AND BOTH SPEED AND 

CONSUMPTION ARE ALWAYS CALCULATED ONLY FROM BEGINNING SEA PASSAGE TO 

END SEA PASSAGE, EXCLUDING ANY VOYAGE UP TO 36 HOURS DURATION, AND 

BOTH SPEED AND CONSUMPTION ARE ALWAYS SUBJECT TO GOOD WEATHER 

CONDITIONS UP TO AND INCLUDING BEAUFORT SCALE 4 AND DOUGLAS SEA 

STATE 3, WITH COMBINED WAVE AND SWELL HEIGHTS NOT TO EXCEED 1.25 M, 

WITHOUT ANY ADVERSE CURRENTS, WITHOUT NEGATIVE INFLUENCE OF SWELL, 

BEING ON EVEN KEEL AND EXCLUDING PERIODS DURING WHICH REDUCTIONS 

OF SPEED FOR SAFETY, REDUCED VISIBILITY, STEAMING AND/OR MANEUVERING 

IN CONGESTED WATERS ETC. 

 

PERIODS EXCEEDING THE AGREED ABOVE MENTIONED GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS 

ARE TO BE EXPRESSLY EXCLUDED WHEN VESSEL'S SPEED EVALUATION IS CONDUCTED, 

NO OTHER EXTRAPOLATION WILL BE ALLOWED. ALWAYS SUBJECT TO GOOD 

QUALITY OF BUNKERS AS AGREED HEREIN. 

 

THE VESSEL IS ALLOWED TO USE MDO/MGO WHEN MANEUVERING AND PASSING 

NARROW / RESTRICTED / CONFINED WATER, INCLUDING WHEN THE VESSEL 

CARRIES OUT HOLD CLEANING AND BILGE PUMPING. 

 

BUNKERS IFO(380 CST) PARAMETERS AS PER ISO8217/2010 

RMG 380 AND MDO AS PER ISO8217/2010 - DMB 

 

IN THE EVENT OF CHARTERERS ORDERING THE VESSEL TO PORT(S) AND/OR 

ANCHORAGE(S) WHERE VESSELS STAY CUMULATIVELY IS EXTENDED FOR MORE 

THAN 20 DAYS OR TO LAYUP SO AS TO CAUSE BOTTOM AND UNDERWATER PARTS 

FOULING, THEN OWNERS REPRESENTATION OF THE ABOVE SPEED AND CONSUMPTION 

TO BE NULL AND VOID EFFECTIVE FROM VESSEL'S DEPARTURE FROM SUCH 

PORT(S) AND/OR ANCHORAGE(S), UNLESS OR UNTIL SO CLEANED. IN ANY CASES 

CHARTERERS MUST CLEAN VESSELS HULL AT THEIR TIME AND EXPENSE PRIOR 

TO REDELIVERY. 

 

(ALL DETS ABT) 

 

 

Best regards,

Michael

mob: +49 172 4531295

skype: Zeitler.M

 

H.VOGEMANN GMBH; 20146 HAMBURG, Hallerstrasse 40 GERMANY 
HRB 17249; MD: A. Woo, F. Jensen. L. Rudebeck

COLD  WEATHER  EXISTS, (B) THE VESSEL’S MAIN ENGINE HAS TO BE STAND-BY
FOR   ANY  REASONS  DURING  LOADING  OR  DISCHARGING  AT  THE  TRADING
PORTS/ANCHORAGES.

DURING  BALLASTING/DEBALLASTING  OPERATIONS AT SEA, ADDITIONAL HSFO IS
USED FOR SECOND AUXILIARY ENGINE.

THE  ABOVE CONSUMPTION REFERS TO FO (380 CST) / LS MGO. ABOVE IS BASIS
UP  TO  BEAUFORT  4  /  DOUGLAS  SEA STATE 3 AND SWELL NOT EXCEEDING 2
METERS   AND   NO   ADVERSE   CURRENTS.  THE  SHIP  MAY  BURN  MGO  IN
NARROW/RESTRICTED  WATERS  AND WHEN MANOEUVRING. ALL ABOUT AND WITHOUT
GUARANTEE.

ECO SPEED AND CONSUMPTION GIVEN IN GOOD FAITH UNDER GOOD WEATHER CONDITION BUT WITHOUT GUARANTEE AT ALL

* Range of power 55 % to 65% of MCR

    * The fuel consumption in this range about 25 MT 

    * Vessel speed at ballast about 12.5knots

    * Vessel speed laden about 11.5knots

 

SPEED // CONSUMPTION Valid up to and including Beaufort Force 4 (11-16 knots) and total combined  (sea and swell) significant wave height confined to limits of Douglas Sea State 3  (0.5-1.25 meters) with no adverse currents. It is understood that the time during which there is bad weather with wind exceeding Beaufort Force 4 and/or Douglas Sea State 3 under opposing current will not be taken into consideration for the calculation of the performance, no warranty applies to condition exceeding beaufort 4 and douglas sea state 3 (0.5-1.25 meters). About in the speed/consumption is defined as “0.50knots” grace in the speed and as “5% more” grace in the consumption

 

Vessel to have the liberty to use Diesel Oil in bad/cold weather and/or entering into or leaving fromport of call and/or maneuvering in narrow/shallow/congested water and/or ballasting/deballasting 

Operations

 

Fuel Quality:

international and local regulations and any subsequent amendments thereto.

/ Eugene 

cc Alex
cc Dmitry
cc Gennadiy

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
GREAT FLUENCY  /   63390.000 MT ON ABT 13.300M OPEN HUANGPU, CHINA 12-13 APRIL
+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

PREFER BACKHAUL OR INDO - WCI COAL, BUT CAN TRY ANY

Vessel Name: GREAT FLUENCY 

Ex. Name: N/A 
Vessel Flag: HONG KONG Call Sign: VRNP2
Official No: HK - 4140 IMO No: 9728679 
Classification: Lloyd’s Register of Shipping(LR)
Class No: 9728679 
Summer Draft[M]: 63390.000 MT ON 13.300 
TPC[Mt]: 62.300
LOA/LBP[M]: 199.900 / 194.500 
Breadth(MLD)[M]: 32.260 
Light Condition[Mt]: 11806.460 
Depth(MLD)[M]: 18.500

Service Speed : 14.40 Kts (Ballast) (about)
                            14.00 Kts (Laden) (about)

At sea -   (Ballast)  F.O. : 28.000 Mt + MDO 0.1mt (about) ME+AE
               (Laden)     F.O. : 30.000 Mt + MDO 0.1mt (about) ME+AE

- ECO SPEED & CONSUMPTION
  BALLAST: ABOUT 13 KNOTS ON ABT 20.5MTS IFO DAILY PLUS 0.1MT MDO. (M/E + A/E)
  LADEN: ABOUT 12.5 KNOTS ON ABT 22.5 MTS IFO DAILY PLUS 0.1MT MDO. (M/E + A/E)
                         
Remarks: 

1.   Marine Fuel Oil Sulfur Requirements for Operating Area from A to F (IMO Marpol Annex VI, EU Directive
2005/33/EC , North America and CARB Regulation as per attached table.)

2. abt 0.1mt of MDO will be used at sea per day

3. at sea additional FO 2.00mt - 2.5mt (about) per day if ballasting, deballasting, ballast water exchange and via
ballast water treatment system is required. 
 
4. Above Speed and Consumption are based on good weather condition and smooth sea maximum Beaufort scale
4, Douglas sea state 3 with no adverse current and no negative influence swell on even keel in still and deep water with
clean bottom, sea buoy to sea buoy, excluding canals, narrows, restricted waters and periods when speed is reduced due
to charterers’ order, reasons of safety and poor visibility, etc. 
In Port Consumption
F.O.        :   3.50 - 4.50 Mt + MDO 0.1Mt (about)   (cargo work) (Ballasting/Deballasting) 
F.O.        :   1.50 - 2.00 Mt + MDO 0.1Mt (about)    ( idle )

Remarks: 

1. Marine Fuel Oil Sulfur Requirements for Operating Area from A to F (IMO Marpol Annex VI, EU Directive
2005/33/EC , North America and CARB Regulation as per attached table.) 

2. Diesel Generator will burn D.O. at low load below 30%, starting & stop condition.

3. Vessel will be required to burn FO/DO/GO with a Sulphur content not exceeding 0.5 percent by mass in Hong
Kong waters as well as in China ECA and any subsequent amendments thereof.

Best regards,
Eugene Grechka

4, Douglas sea state 3 with no adverse current and no negative influence swell on even keel in still and deep water with

  BALLAST: ABOUT 13 KNOTS ON ABT 20.5MTS IFO DAILY PLUS 0.1MT MDO. (M/E + A/E)
  LADEN: ABOUT 12.5 KNOTS ON ABT 22.5 MTS IFO DAILY PLUS 0.1MT MDO. (M/E + A/E)
                         
Remarks: 

1.   Marine Fuel Oil Sulfur Requirements for Operating Area from A to F (IMO Marpol Annex VI, EU Directive
2005/33/EC , North America and CARB Regulation as per attached table.)

2. abt 0.1mt of MDO will be used at sea per day

3. at sea additional FO 2.00mt - 2.5mt (about) per day if ballasting, deballasting, ballast water exchange and via
ballast water treatment system is required. 
 
4. Above Speed and Consumption are based on good weather condition and smooth sea maximum Beaufort scale
4, Douglas sea state 3 with no adverse current and no negative influence swell on even keel in still and deep water with
clean bottom, sea buoy to sea buoy, excluding canals, narrows, restricted waters and periods when speed is reduced due
to charterers’ order, reasons of safety and poor visibility, etc. 
In Port Consumption
F.O.        :   3.50 - 4.50 Mt + MDO 0.1Mt (about)   (cargo work) (Ballasting/Deballasting) 
F.O.        :   1.50 - 2.00 Mt + MDO 0.1Mt (about)    ( idle )

Remarks: 

1. Marine Fuel Oil Sulfur Requirements for Operating Area from A to F (IMO Marpol Annex VI, EU Directive
2005/33/EC , North America and CARB Regulation as per attached table.) 

2. Diesel Generator will burn D.O. at low load below 30%, starting & stop condition.

3. Vessel will be required to burn FO/DO/GO with a Sulphur content not exceeding 0.5 percent by mass in Hong
Kong waters as well as in China ECA and any subsequent amendments thereof.

BOILER INCLUDED IFO 380CST

BOILER INCLUDED IFO 380CST

WORKING: ABT 5.0 MT IFO

PLEASE  ADD  EXTRA CONSUMPTION FROM 0.5-1.0 MTNS/DAY FOR BOILER (A) IF

FOR   ANY  REASONS  DURING  LOADING  OR  DISCHARGING  AT  THE  TRADING
PORTS/ANCHORAGES.

DURING  BALLASTING/DEBALLASTING  OPERATIONS AT SEA, ADDITIONAL HSFO IS
USED FOR SECOND AUXILIARY ENGINE.

NARROW/RESTRICTED  WATERS  AND WHEN MANOEUVRING. ALL ABOUT AND WITHOUT
GUARANTEE.

ballast water treatment system is required. 
 
4. Above Speed and Consumption are based on good weather condition and smooth sea maximum Beaufort scale
4, Douglas sea state 3 with no adverse current and no negative influence swell on even keel in still and deep water with
clean bottom, sea buoy to sea buoy, excluding canals, narrows, restricted waters and periods when speed is reduced due
to charterers’ order, reasons of safety and poor visibility, etc. 
In Port Consumption
F.O.        :   3.50 - 4.50 Mt + MDO 0.1Mt (about)   (cargo work) (Ballasting/Deballasting) 
F.O.        :   1.50 - 2.00 Mt + MDO 0.1Mt (about)    ( idle )

Remarks: 

1. Marine Fuel Oil Sulfur Requirements for Operating Area from A to F (IMO Marpol Annex VI, EU Directive
2005/33/EC , North America and CARB Regulation as per attached table.) 

2. Diesel Generator will burn D.O. at low load below 30%, starting & stop condition.

3. Vessel will be required to burn FO/DO/GO with a Sulphur content not exceeding 0.5 percent by mass in Hong Kong waters as well as in China ECA and any subsequent amendments thereof.


Best regards,
Eugene Grechka

VESSEL CONSUMES IFO AND/OR MDO/MGO WHILE CHANGING BALLAST WATER AT
SEA, BALLASTING/DEBALLASTING, CLEANING VESSEL S HOLDS, WHEN
NAVIGATING/MANOEUVRING IN CONFINED WATERS, RIVERS, CHANNELS IN/OUT
PORTS.
BASIS GOOD WEATHER AND BASIS SMOOTH SEA. GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS ARE
UNDERSTOOD TO MEAN WIND SPEEDS OF BEAUFORT FORCE 4 (MAX 16 KNOTS) AND
TOTAL COMBINED (SEA AND SWELL) SIGNIFICANT WAVE HEIGHT CONFINED TO
LIMITS OF DOUGLAS SEA STATE 3 WITH NO ADVERSE CURRENTS AND NO SWELL.
NO EXTRAPOLATIONS TO BE MADE FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS OTHER THAN THOSE
DESCRIBED ABOVE. ABOUT IS UNDERSTOOD TO MEAN 5 DOWNWARDS IN THE SPEED
AND 5 UPWARDS IN THE CONSUMPTION.
ALL DETAILS ABOUT

VESSEL ABLE TO BUNKER ISO 8217:2005 IF/WHEN 2010 NOT AVAILABLE



Kind Regards
Pavel Golubev

ABOVE SPEED AND CONSUMPTION ARE GIVEN ON THE BASIS OF GOOD WEATHER AND SEA CONDITION I.E.
WIND FORCE BEAUFORT SCALE MAXIMUM 4, DOUGLAS SEA STATE 3, AND NO ADVERSE CURRENT
VESSEL HAS LIBERTY TO BURN ADDITIONAL MDO WHEN MANEUVERING IN NARROW/ SHALLOW/ RESTRICTED
WATERS, CANALS, RIVERS, POOR VISIBILITY, HEAVY TRAFFIC AND IN AND/OR OUT OF PORT AND ENGINE
STARTING/ STOPPING, WORKING WITH LOW LOAD, FREQUENT LOAD CHANGE, SHIFT OF GENERATOR ENGINES.

BASED ON EVEN KEEL, CLEAN HULL, GOOD FUEL AND GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS UP TO
BEAUFORT SCALE 4 (MAX 16 KNOTS) AND TOTAL COMBINED (SEA AND SWELL)
SIGNIFICANT WAVE HEIGHT CONFINED TO LIMITS OF DOUGLAS SEA STATE 3
WITH NO ADVERSE CURRENTS NO SWELLS.

NO EXTRAPOLATIONS TO BE MADE FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS OTHER THAN THOSE
DESCRIBED ABOVE. ABOUT IS UNDERSTOOD TO MEAN 0.5KNTS DOWNWARDS IN THE SPEED AND 5% UPWARDS IN THE CONSUMPTION.

VESSEL HAS LIBERTY TO CONSUME MARINE GAS OIL WHEN MANOEU VERING,IN/OUT PORTS,STARTING OF AUXILIARY BURNING OF SLUDGE OIL

At 50% MCR conditions, the vessel should run full speed in an hour within every 24 hours

 

Speed and consumption figures are basis under good weather condition and smooth sea and no negative influence by currents, swell and/or tidal streams, maximum Beaufort 4 and Douglas 3 and even keel in deep water with clean bottom, maximum sea temperature 28 degree Celsius, except restricted areas, like approaches, shallow waters, etc. Evidence of weather conditions to be taken from vessel’s deck logs.

++


OPEN DONGHAE, S. KOREA O/A MAY 2
 
 
- MV WOOYANG VENUS

STSDBC GEARLESS, KOREA FLAG, BUILT YEAER 1995, KR
SUMMER 73,081MT DWT ON 13.913M SSW (TPC 65.4)
LOA 224.95 MTRS BEAM 32.24 MTRS
GRT 38,464 NRT 24,655
GRAIN 85,607 CBM
7 HOLDS 7 HATCHES; SIDE-ROLLING TYPE


AT SEA
ABT 12.7KNTS ON ABT IFO 26MT + 0.1MT MDO
ABT 11.5KNTS ON ABT IFO 27MT + 0.1MT MDO

 
AT PORT
ABT IFO 2.0MT + 0.1MT MDO (IDLE)
ABT IFO 3.0MT + 0.1MT MDO (WORKING)
ALL FIGURES ARE ABOUT, AND "ABOUT" MEANS 0.5 KNOTS FOR SPEED AND 5% MARGIN FOR BUNKER CONSUMPTION FOR OWNERS' FAVOR.



ABOVE SPEED AND CONSUMPTION ARE GIVEN ON THE BASIS OF GOOD WEATHER AND SEA CONDITION I.E.
WIND FORCE BEAUFORT SCALE MAXIMUM 4, DOUGLAS SEA STATE 3, AND NO ADVERSE CURRENT
VESSEL HAS LIBERTY TO BURN ADDITIONAL MDO WHEN MANEUVERING IN NARROW/ SHALLOW/ RESTRICTED
WATERS, CANALS, RIVERS, POOR VISIBILITY, HEAVY TRAFFIC AND IN AND/OR OUT OF PORT AND ENGINE
STARTING/ STOPPING, WORKING WITH LOW LOAD, FREQUENT LOAD CHANGE, SHIFT OF GENERATOR ENGINES.

BASED ON EVEN KEEL, CLEAN HULL, GOOD FUEL AND GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS UP TO
BEAUFORT SCALE 4 (MAX 16 KNOTS) AND TOTAL COMBINED (SEA AND SWELL)
SIGNIFICANT WAVE HEIGHT CONFINED TO LIMITS OF DOUGLAS SEA STATE 3
WITH NO ADVERSE CURRENTS NO SWELLS.

NO EXTRAPOLATIONS TO BE MADE FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS OTHER THAN THOSE
DESCRIBED ABOVE. ABOUT IS UNDERSTOOD TO MEAN 0.5KNTS DOWNWARDS IN THE SPEED AND 5% UPWARDS IN THE CONSUMPTION.

VESSEL HAS LIBERTY TO CONSUME MARINE GAS OIL WHEN MANOEU VERING,IN/OUT PORTS,STARTING OF AUXILIARY BURNING OF SLUDGE OIL

YANGTZE HAPPINESS: LOG / BULK CARRIER HONGKONG FLAG / 2012 BUILT IN CHINA / CLASSED LRS 32,456MT DWT ON 10.15M SSW GRT 20,924 / NRT 11,786 LOA 179.90M / BEAM 28.40M 5HA-5HO, CRANE 4X30T DESIGN LOAD TANK TOP: 20.0 MT/CBM UPPER DECK SIDE:4.0 MT/CBM CROSS DECK: 4.0 MT/CBM HATCH COVER: 3.30 MT/CBM TTL HOLD GRAIN CAPA 43,477.4CBM NO..1 7,063.2 NO..2 9,652.1 NO..3 9,053.0 NO..4 9,650.4 NO..5 8,058.7 ELECTRIC -HYDRAULIC FOLDING TPYE HATCH COVERS HATCH SIZE NO..1)14.4X17.6M, NO.2-4)20.0X19.2M NO.5) 18.4X19.2M

SPEED/CONSUMPTION: ABT 14.0 KN ON ABT 23.9 MTS IFO 380CST + ABT 0.1MT MGO, BALLAST ABT 13.0 KN ON ABT 24.9MTS IFO 380CST + ABT 0.1MT MGO, LADEN “ABT” MEANS AN ALLOWANCE OF +/-0.5KN ON SPEED AND 5PCT ON CONSUMPTION PORT CONSUMPTION:

IDLE/WORK ABT 2.7MTS IFO + ABT 0.1MT MGO / ABT 4.5MTS IFO +ABT 0.1MT MGO; PLUS ALWAYS EXTRA 0.5MT FOR WINTER/COLD SEASON ALL CONSUMPTIONS PER DAY ABOVE CONSUMPTIONS ARE BASED ON SHIP'S SERVICE AND EXCLUDE BALLASTING/DEBALLASTING/ EXCHANGE OF BALLAST, BILGES PUMPING, HEATING OF HFO AND ENTERING / LEAVING PORTS ABOVE SPEEDS AND CONSUMPTIONS ARE GIVEN BASIS EVEN KEEL, CLEAN HULL, CLEAN FUEL, GOOD WEATHER AND SEA CONDITIONS I.E. WIND FORCE BEAUFORT SCALE MAX 4 (FOUR), DOUGLAS SEA STATE 3 (THREE) AND NO NEGATIVE INFLUENCE BY SWELL/ADVERSE CURRENTS AND/OR TIDAL STREAMS.

VESSEL TO BE SUPPLIED WITH BUNKERS OF MAX 3.5% SULPHUR CONTENT AND NOT INFERIOR TO: RMG 380 AND MGO DMA AS PER ISO 8217/2005 OR ISO 8217/2010 AND ANY REVISION THEREOF THE VESSEL HAS LIBERTY TO BURN MARINE DIESEL OIL IN CASE OF EMERGENCY OR WHILE NAVIGATING/MANEUVERING IN NARROW SHALLOW /RESTRICTED/CONGESTED WATERS, CANALS, RIVERS, ENTERING/LEAVING PORTS/CANALS, STARTING/ TOPPING THE ENGINE, BALLAST WATER EXCHANGING, CLEANING VSL'S HOLDS,BALLASTING/DE-BALLASTING OPERATION, OR AT LOW LOAD AND/OR BAD/COLD WEATHER CONDITION ETC ALWAYS AT THE DISCRETION OF THE MASTER. FOR THE PURPOSE OF CALCULATING VSL'S PERFORMANCE UNDER THIS C/P, IT IS AGREED THAT ALL DAYS WHERE THE WEATHER EXCEEDS BEAUFORT FORCE 4 AND/OR DOUGLAS SEA STATE 3 ARE EXPRESSLY EXCLUDED FROM CALCULATIONS All details about

ECO SPEED/CONS IS GIVEN WOG Following Eco figures will be added into the vessel description. VESSEL WILL ONLY STEAM AT FOLLOWING RPM, all the fwg. Speed/consumptions to be wog and for ref only 124RPM BALLASTING ABT 13K/ABT 21.9 MT IFO 380CST+0.1MT MGO,LADEN ABT 12.6K/ABT 23.2MT IFO 380CST+0.1MT MGO 117RPM BALLASTING ABT 12.5K/ABT 19.9MT IFO 380CST+0.1MT MGO, LADEN ABT 12.1K/ABT 20.1MT IFO 380CST+0.1MT MGO 108RPM BLALLASTING ABT 12K/ABT 17.2MT IFO 380CST+0.1MT MGO,LADEN ABT 11.2K/ABT 17.6MT IFO 380CST+0.1MT MGO ADA

IDLE/WORK ABT 2.7MTS IFO + ABT 0.1MT MGO / ABT 4.5MTS IFO +ABT 0.1MT MGO; PLUS ALWAYS EXTRA 0.5MT FOR WINTER/COLD SEASON ALL CONSUMPTIONS PER DAY ABOVE CONSUMPTIONS ARE BASED ON SHIP'S SERVICE AND EXCLUDE BALLASTING/DEBALLASTING/ EXCHANGE OF BALLAST, BILGES PUMPING, HEATING OF HFO AND ENTERING / LEAVING PORTS ABOVE SPEEDS AND CONSUMPTIONS ARE GIVEN BASIS EVEN KEEL, CLEAN HULL, CLEAN FUEL, GOOD WEATHER AND SEA CONDITIONS I.E. WIND FORCE BEAUFORT SCALE MAX 4 (FOUR), DOUGLAS SEA STATE 3 (THREE) AND NO NEGATIVE INFLUENCE BY SWELL/ADVERSE CURRENTS AND/OR TIDAL STREAMS.

VESSEL TO BE SUPPLIED WITH BUNKERS OF MAX 3.5% SULPHUR CONTENT AND NOT INFERIOR TO: RMG 380 AND MGO DMA AS PER ISO 8217/2005 OR ISO 8217/2010 AND ANY REVISION THEREOF THE VESSEL HAS LIBERTY TO BURN MARINE DIESEL OIL IN CASE OF EMERGENCY OR WHILE NAVIGATING/MANEUVERING IN NARROW SHALLOW /RESTRICTED/CONGESTED WATERS, CANALS, RIVERS, ENTERING/LEAVING PORTS/CANALS, STARTING/ TOPPING THE ENGINE, BALLAST WATER EXCHANGING, CLEANING VSL'S HOLDS,BALLASTING/DE-BALLASTING OPERATION, OR AT LOW LOAD AND/OR BAD/COLD WEATHER CONDITION ETC ALWAYS AT THE DISCRETION OF THE MASTER. FOR THE PURPOSE OF CALCULATING VSL'S PERFORMANCE UNDER THIS C/P, IT IS AGREED THAT ALL DAYS WHERE THE WEATHER EXCEEDS BEAUFORT FORCE 4 AND/OR DOUGLAS SEA STATE 3 ARE EXPRESSLY EXCLUDED FROM CALCULATIONS All details about

ECO SPEED/CONS IS GIVEN WOG Following Eco figures will be added into the vessel description. VESSEL WILL ONLY STEAM AT FOLLOWING RPM, all the fwg. Speed/consumptions to be wog and for ref only 124RPM BALLASTING ABT 13K/ABT 21.9 MT IFO 380CST+0.1MT MGO,LADEN ABT 12.6K/ABT 23.2MT IFO 380CST+0.1MT MGO 117RPM BALLASTING ABT 12.5K/ABT 19.9MT IFO 380CST+0.1MT MGO, LADEN ABT 12.1K/ABT 20.1MT IFO 380CST+0.1MT MGO 108RPM BLALLASTING ABT 12K/ABT 17.2MT IFO 380CST+0.1MT MGO,LADEN ABT 11.2K/ABT 17.6MT IFO 380CST+0.1MT MGO ADA

WORKING WITH LOW LOAD, FREQUENT LOAD CHANGE, SHIFT OF GENERATOR ENGINES.

ULO (USED LUBRICATION OIL) OR OTHER WASTE PRODUCTS ARE STRICTLY NOT PERMITTED AND NOT TO BE INCLUDED IN THE FUELS SUPPLIED. LSMGO SUPPLIED TO HAVE MAX SULPHUR CONTENT OF 0.1%.
